messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Asteroids are rocks that fly through space. Some of these rocks can be dangerous. They are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' if they pass close to our planet. This means they come within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's path around the sun.

NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these asteroids. However, they do not think any of them will be a danger in the next 100 years. With the technology we have now, NASA can follow these objects. They can also say if one might hit Earth. If this happens, there are two ways to defend our planet.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. The sentence 'However, they do not think any of them will be a danger in the next 100 years' exceeds the 15-word limit. The word 'defend' is B2 level and is not a defined keyword. It must be replaced with a simpler word like 'protect'.

Text saved: Asteroids are rocks that fly through space. Some of these rocks can be dangerous. They are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' if they pass close to our planet. This means they come within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's path around the sun.

NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these asteroids. But none of them are a danger for the next 100 years. With the technology we have now, NASA can follow these objects. They can also say if one might hit Earth. If this happens, there are two ways to protect our planet.

metadata.feedback_text: The text is a flawless example of B1 writing. Sentences are short and clear. Vocabulary is perfectly controlled. Complex concepts like 'Earth's orbit' are accurately simplified to 'Earth's path around the sun'. The keyword 'Asteroids' is defined simply. All facts from the original text are present and correct.
